page.title: 20DYMOCK FARM, SEAFORD
page.content: { DYMOCK FARM}IS JUST NORTH OF THE A259 ROAD AND TO THE WEST OF THE CUCKMERE RIVER. THE SOIL IS MEDIUM LOAM OVER CHALK. THERE IS A FARMHOUSE, AND IN THE THREE BARNS MACHINARY, TRACTORS, STRAW, HAY, CATTLE FEED PELLETS, GRAIN FOR THE CHICKENS AND CHEMICAL FERTILIZERS ARE KEPT. { MRS. WHITE}AND HER SON RUN THIS FARM IN CONJUNCTION WITH ANOTHER ONE IN BISHOPSTONE TWO MILES AWAY. THEY HAVE {214 ACRES}HERE, AND GROW{WHEAT}AS A MAIN CROP ON 150 ACRES. THEY GROW {POTATOES}(WILJA AND DESIREE VARIETIES) ON 10 ACRES AND OTHER{VEGETABLES}ON 8 ACRES. THE REST OF THE LAND, WHICH IS STEEPER AND NEAR THE RIVER, IS GRAZING FOR THEIR{42 BEEF CATTLE.}THEY KEEP {120 CHICKENS}AND HAVE RECENTLY OPENED {A FARM SHOP}TO SELL THE EGGS, POTATOES AND VEGETABLES. THE REST OF THE PRODUCE IS SOLD AT MARKET OR EXPORTED.
